speaker: A
text: All the coins in my bag are dumping hard. Should I cut my losses or HODL?

speaker: B
text: This reminds me of a friend of mine who paid for an expensive gym membership but never went.

speaker: B
text: One day, he finally forced himself to go. He walked in, saw all the fit people lifting weights, got intimidated, and left immediately.

speaker: A
text: What does that have to do with my investment?

speaker: B
text: See, just like him with his gym membership, you’ve already committed to this. If you leave now, you’ve wasted all that effort. But if you stay, maybe—just maybe—you’ll get strong enough to lift that emotional burden.

speaker: B
text: Or maybe it’s just nonsense, and I distracted you long enough for your bag to recover.
